text: The Académie internationale Mohammed VI de l'aviation civile (AIMAC, in English International Academy Mohammed VI of Civil Aviation) is a public aviation university created in 2000 by the King Mohammed VI of Morocco for aerospace education in this country,Présentation like Air Traffic Safety Electronics Personnel training.L'academie Internationale MohammedVI de l'aviation civileL’Académie Internationale Mohammed VI de l’aviation civile void grand == International partners == The French Civil Aviation University (ENAC) of Toulouse is close to the university by a partnership agreement,Académie internationale mohammed VI de l'aviation civile in particularly for air navigation courses. In December 2011, the academy has launched with this grande école and the École des Ponts ParisTech an aviation MBA at Casablanca.UN NOUVEL EXECUTIVE MBA POUR L’AVIATIONL'AIAC lance un Executive MBA in Aviation Management The Federal Aviation Administration is also a partner of AIMAC, in particular for the launch of common e-learning courses. ==References== == Further reading == * Official website Category:Aerospace engineering Category:Aviation organizations Category:2000 establishments in Africa Category:Technical colleges and universities Category:Casablanca Category:20th-century establishments in Morocco Category:Organizations based in Morocco
title: Mohammed VI International Academy of Civil Aviation
